comment: She is amazing. Her notes are extremely helpful. Tests were fairly easy as long as you studied the notes. She is really kind and makes lectures engaging.

One of the best professors I've ever had. Dr. Gruss will demystify the difficult content and walk you through the best examples to solve even the most complex problems with ease. Homework is fair, quizzes were in groups, and the exams were on the content we learned - nothing new or surprising or tricks. Definitely take her for any course you can!
you will learn very well not because she is easy because she knows how to teach class is hard so practice a lot and attend the class for better undrestanding
Her structure is designed to make sure you learn and succeed.

Best professor I have had. She makes me want to explore the subject more. Great lectures they were never drawn out and tiring even though I had her at 6:30pm. She tests what she teaches. She is reachable outside of class. She does not hesitate to slow down and explain concepts. She is a fair graded. She really made a difficult subject pretty easy.

She actually might be the best professor I had ever since I moved to KSU. But I took her class for granted and only got serious with the subject when the semester was almost done. The lectures are great, she is always accessible for any questions, and she always shares her own experiences and tips to be an engineer!

She probably the best professor I've ever had. What she teaches in class is on the test and she gives a review before the test. If you follow what she tells you to study you will make an A/B I just never put units, so probably an A for most people.

Dr. Amy Gruss is a fantastic professor! I liked her teaching style as she explained everything in detail and assessed the students well. She is considerate of students' emergency situations and allows assignment makeups. Above all she is extremely passionate about the subject and makes her students excited to learn and change the environment.
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: Professor Gruss was amazing! She made the lectures fun when possible, so it did not feel like a long boring lecture every class period. She gave an extra credit opportunity at the end of the semester which was not a very difficult assignment, and helps you study more for the exam anyways, so why not do it? Shes willing to give extra help if needed

She tells you what is going to be on the exams and every math problem on the test has been worked on in class before. 3 group projects that arent that hard and gives you lots of time to complete. Class ended early almost every lecture b/c there is not much to teach in this class. Replies to emails quickly. Also the hottest prof. Ive ever had
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Graded by few things--Group projects

comment: She is one of the best engineering professors I have ever encountered. She teaches from her notes, without reading them word for word. Her tests are always similar to the class notes; she gives you everything you need to succeed. She loves teaching fluids/hydrology, and she really wants every student to pass. A must-take professor in your degree.

I got B cuz I did not study enough. Her lecture is awesome and easy to understand. Exam and quiz are similar to lecture and class examples. you will learn and you have to study to pass and to get good grades. Realy on her notes and class lecture. No INTERNET source for any hw or quiz.

She allows open note, open book exams and quizzes. She is an amazing lecturer, and willing to discuss any difficulties you are experiencing in the class. She let's you know ahead of time what material will be covered on the exam, so as long as you take good notes, you're set for an A.

Dr. Gruss is an amazing professor. She knows her stuff and thus is very good at teaching it. She teaches through powerpoint and onenote, so I recommend printing the powerpoint and taking notes on them. Also, tests and quizzes were open notes, and having detailed notes help. I would HIGHLY recommend taking her for fluids.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Skip class? You won't pass.--Amazing lectures

comment: Hands down one of the best professors I ever had. She does an excellent job at explaining concepts and lets you know what she expects from you on exams. Exams and quizzes are easy if you actually pay attention and practice statics. Made an A in there last semester and taking her for fluids next fall.

One of the better professors I have taken. Very nice and will actually take the time to explain a complex subject that people are having trouble understanding. Enjoys what she does which translates into an actually interesting class

she was very straightforward. Small class, which made it boring, but she teaches well, and is transparent about how she will grade. She teaches you well and shows what will be on tests. group projects are easy too. only thing i didn't like was the mandatory field trips.
Had her for Fluids Lab, wish I could take her for lecture.

Dr. Gruss was an excellent lab professor. She always made sure she prepared you for each lab and you never feel lost doing the labs based on her lectures. She's always willing to answer questions via email or office hours. She also grades labs and tests pretty  mildly, and offers some bonus for each lab. Midterm and final were straightforward.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Clear grading criteria

comment: She is very understanding just stay on top of your work and you will have great success in this course! She wants you to see succeed!

Dr. Gruss is an exceptional professor.  She is knowledgeable, a good communicator, and a very fair grader.  You really can't ask for more.  She is truly invested in teaching and it shows.  Do not miss the opportunity to take her!
